title.value: Use of machine learning in pediatric surgical clinical prediction tools: A systematic review
title.justification: The title of the paper explicitly states the focus of the research as the use of machine learning in pediatric surgical clinical prediction tools.
title.quote: Use of machine learning in pediatric surgical clinical prediction tools: A systematic review

extractions.description: This paper is a systematic review comparing the validity and clinical efficacy of machine learning-based clinical prediction tools to traditional ones in pediatric surgery.

type.justification: The paper is based on a systematic review of existing literature, which involves empirical evaluation of studies comparing machine learning-based tools to traditional ones.
type.quote: This systematic review aims to compare the validity and clinical efficacy of ML-based to traditional CPTs in pediatric surgery.

name.justification: The research is focused on the application of clinical prediction tools in pediatric surgical conditions.
name.quote: This systematic review aims to compare the validity and clinical efficacy of ML-based to traditional CPTs in pediatric surgery.

name.justification: The paper discusses the application of machine learning models within the context of clinical prediction tools for healthcare.
name.quote: Recent advancements in artificial intelligence have resulted in a proliferation of CPTs created using machine learning (ML).

name.justification: The paper analyzes different clinical prediction tools used in pediatric surgery, which is central to the study.
name.quote: CPTs are defined as clinical decision-making instruments which utilize different aspects of the patient's clinical history.

name.justification: Random forest is mentioned as the most utilized ML method in the studies reviewed.
name.quote: The most utilized ML methods were random forest (54.2%).

is_contributed.justification: Random Forest is a well-established machine learning model and is not contributed in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: The most utilized ML methods were random forest (54.2%).

is_executed.justification: As this is a systematic review, the model itself is not executed within the paper.
is_executed.quote: The most utilized ML methods were random forest (54.2%).

is_compared.justification: The paper compares the performance of ML-based CPTs, including random forest, to traditional CPTs.
is_compared.quote: Thirty-nine of the included studies compared ML-based CPTs with either other ML models or logistic regression.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper titles are not provided for each specific model in the review.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Table S1 highlights the specific ML models used in each study.

name.justification: Decision trees are mentioned as one of the top three ML methods used in the reviewed studies.
name.quote: The most utilized ML methods were random forest (54.2%) followed by decision trees (37.5%).

is_contributed.justification: Decision Trees are established machine learning models and are not contributed in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: The most utilized ML methods were random forest (54.2%) followed by decision trees (37.5%).

is_executed.justification: As this is a systematic review, the model itself is not executed within the paper.
is_executed.quote: The most utilized ML methods were random forest (54.2%) followed by decision trees (37.5%).

is_compared.justification: The paper analyzes studies that compare ML-based CPTs using models like Decision Trees to traditional methods.
is_compared.quote: Thirty-nine of the included studies compared ML-based CPTs with either other ML models or logistic regression.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper titles for the models are not provided in the review.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Table S1 highlights the specific ML models used in each study.
